column10: the holiday is known by its Sanskrit name (Vaiśākha) and derived variants of it.------On this day
column11: devout Buddhists and followers  assemble in their various temples before dawn for the ceremonial and honorable hoisting of the Buddhist flag and the singing of hymns in praise of the holy triple gem: The Buddha
column13: and The Sangha (his disciples).------Devotees may bring simple offerings of flowers
column14: candles and joss-sticks to lay at the feet of their teacher. These symbolic offerings are to remind followers that just as the beautiful flowers would wither away after a short while
column15: and the candles and joss-sticks would soon burn out
column16: so too is life subject to decay and destruction.------Birds
